artefact.overview: To use commercial craft on inland waterways in Northern Ireland you must be registered with Waterways Ireland
artefact.licence_short_description: Register with Waterways Ireland to use commercial craft on inland waterways in Northern Ireland.
artefact.licence_overview:
Commercial craft used on inland waterways in Northern Ireland must be registered with Waterways Ireland.

##Conditions
Before registration you must:

- have had the vessel surveyed by the Maritime and Coastguard Agency (MCA)
- ensure the master of the vessel is in the possession of a Boatmaster's licence issued from the MCA

##How to apply
Register with [Waterways Ireland](http://www.waterwaysireland.org/index.cfm/section/article/page/BoatRegistration "Register with Waterways Ireland"){:rel="external"}

You must register in order to use the Erne System if your boat has an engine more powerful than 7.5 kilowatts. The boat must also display the registration number.

The Lower Bann Navigation does not require registration, but you will still be required to inform Waterways Ireland of your intention to conduct a commercial operation.

*[MCA]: Maritime and Coastguard Agency
